title: EU says US stand on patent virus waiver is no 'magic bullet'
author: RAF CASERT; BARRY HATTON; Associated Press
description: PORTO, Portugal (AP) — European Union leaders cranked up their criticism of the U. S. call to waive COVID-19 vaccine patents Saturday, arguing the move would yield no short-term or intermediate improvement in vaccine supplies and could even have a negative impact. On the second day of an EU summit in Portugal, the European leaders instead urged Washington to lift export restrictions if it wants to have a global impact on the pandemic.
